arts.ttl: Sunderland vs Arsenal – Match Preview and Team News
arts.sum: Premier League leaders Arsenal travel to the Stadium of Light today for one of their toughest tests of the season. They face a high-flying Sunderland side, who have been the league’s surprise package. Furthermore, the Gunners arrive in formidable shape, currently on a ten-match winning streak in all competitions. arts.ttl: Starting XI: Is this the Sunderland team that will gun down the Gunners?
arts.sum: After an excellent display at Chelsea, our opening 30 minutes against Everton proved there’s no resting on our laurels – and with both Granit Xhaka and Enzo Le Fee pretty critical of the team’s approach in the opening stages last time out, you’d hope we don’t see a repeat of that any time soon. arts.ttl: Sunderland vs Arsenal: Premier League Preview, Gameweek 11, 2025
arts.sum: Sunderland welcome Arsenal to the Stadium of Light in a game that has top-of-the-table significance. If Arsenal are to be defeated, Xhaka will be the key to securing the Black Cats a memorable victory.

arts.ttl: Arteta admits Arsenal do have to beat Sunderland this weekend
arts.sum: Mikel Arteta has emphasised that winning Arsenal’s upcoming game against Sunderland will not automatically secure the Premier League title, but the manager admits that the fixture is one they must take seriously. arts.sum: The Switzerland international midfielder started his coaching badges during his time at Arsenal

arts.ttl: Mikel Arteta admits it was not an ‘easy decision’ to part ways with Granit Xhaka
arts.sum: “When we signed him, it was for the right reason, because he was playing a different role. But he was excellent, when you see him playing for the national team and with Bayer Leverkusen in a deeper role he did very well, as well as the necessity of the team or the understanding of the manager or the coach about a player or the chemistry that he can create around other players as well.
